info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued July 18 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... The South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control in Columbia SC has issued a Code Orange Fine Particulates Action Day for the Upstate and Catawba regions of South Carolina, until midnight EDT tonight. An air quality action day for fine particulates means that concentrations may approach or exceed unhealthy standards. Residents of South Carolina should be aware of the risk for health effects related to smoke. Areas of smoke create hazy skies and unhealthy breathing conditions, especially where it is most concentrated. Smoke can irritate the eyes and the respiratory system, as well as aggravate or exacerbate chronic heart and lung diseases. South Carolina DHEC recommends that individuals with respiratory health issues limit time spent outdoors to avoid smoke and dust. Take measures to prevent smoke and dust from getting inside. Keep windows and doors closed. If operating an air conditioner/central heating unit, keep the fresh-air intake closed and the filter clean to prevent outdoor pollutants from getting inside. For additional information about smoke and its health effects, please visit the South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control website at: http://www.scdhec.gov/HomeAndEnvironment/DisasterPreparedness/ Wildfires/
